definition: to call by the glorified name of (idiom)
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: He dignified a small collection of books by calling it a library.
sentences.chinese: 他把寥寥幾冊藏書美其名曰圖書館。

sentences.english: They call it the balance. I call it hypocritical bullshit.
sentences.chinese: 他們美其名曰平衡，我卻寧願稱之爲虛僞的狗屎。

sentences.english: The trade name for this type of spying is the "honey trap."
sentences.chinese: 這類間諜活動美其名曰“美人計”。

sentences.english: Most are euphemistically called sports or leisure clubs.
sentences.chinese: 大多數都美其名曰運動或者休閒俱樂部。

definition: to think up every possible method (idiom); to devise ways and means/to try this, that and the other
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
and so on/so and so/many and confused
military banner/flag signal/(fig.) banner (i.e. false pretenses)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
to want absolutely/to insist on (doing something)
